properties.areaDesc: Point Isabelle to Lower Entrance of Portage Canal MI; Huron Islands to Marquette MI; Munising to Grand Marais MI; Lake Superior West of Line from Manitou Island to Marquette MI Beyond 5NM from shore; Manitou Island to Point Isabelle MI; Grand Marais to Whitefish Point MI; Lake Superior East of a line from Manitou Island to Marquette MI and West of a line from Grand Marais MI to the US/Canadian Border Beyond 5NM from shore; Portage Lake to Huron Island MI to Lower Entrance of Portage Canal To Huron Islands MI Including Keweenaw and Huron Bays; Marquette to Munising MI; Lake Superior from Grand Marais MI to Whitefish Point MI 5NM off shore to the US/Canadian border
properties.headline: Heavy Freezing Spray Warning issued February 12 at 3:58AM EST until February 14 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy freezing spray at a rate of 2 cm per hour or
greater expected, and may rapidly accumulate on vessels. North
winds 20 to 30 kt with gusts up to 40 kt and waves 8 to 13
feet expected.

* WHERE...Portions of Central and Eastern Lake Superior.

* WHEN...For the Heavy Freezing Spray Warning, from 1 PM this
afternoon to 1 AM EST Friday. For the Gale Warning, from 1 PM
this afternoon to 7 AM EST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Operating a vessel in heavy freezing spray is
hazardous. Freezing spray may render mechanical and electronic
components inoperative. Rapid ice accretion on decks and
superstructures may result in a catastrophic loss of
stability. Strong winds will cause hazardous waves which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should prepare for dangerous accumulation of ice on
their vessel. If possible, remain in port, avoid the warning area
or conduct mitigation.

Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: GALE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST THURSDAY... ...HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM EST FRIDAY
